pages.title: Big Bash 2025 - Adelaide Strikers Vs Sydney Thunder
pages.description: Adelaide Strikers Vs Sydney Thunder Live Streaming Free

seo.meta_title: Sydney Thunder Vs Adelaide Strikers Live
seo.meta_description:
Matt Short and the Adelaide Strikers host David Warner and the Sydney Thunder in a crucial clash at the Adelaide Oval.

The sixth placed Strikers are coming off a loss to the Perth Scorchers, while the last placed Thunder are coming off a loss to the Hobart Hurricanes.

That despite David Warner blasting an astonishing 130 not out as he tries to will his side back into finals contention.

paragraphs:
Short and Chris Lynn will be the danger men at the top of the order for the Strikers, while Lloyd Pope and Tabraiz Shamsi have been amongst the wickets this season.

For the Thunder Warner and Sam Konstas will lead the charge with the bat, while Daniel Sams and Chris Green will be key men with the ball in hand.

It sets the scene for a must win clash for both sides as they aim to keep themselves in finals contention.

SQUADS

Adelaide Strikers: Hassan Ali, Mackenzie Harvey, Chris Lynn, Harry Manenti, Jamie Overton, Lloyd Pope, Alex Ross, Jason Sangha, Liam Scott, Matt Short (c), Henry Thornton, Jerrssis Wadia, Luke Wood

Sydney Thunder: Wes Agar, Tom Andrews, Cameron Bancroft, Sam Billings, Chris Green, Matthew Gilkes, Ryan Hadley, Sam Konstas, Nic Maddinson, Nathan McAndrew, Daniel Sams, Tanveer Sangha, David Warner (c), David Willey

pages.title: MI Cape Town vs Joburg Super Kings, 15th Match
pages.description:
The SA20 2025-26 season moves forward, as MI Cape Town (MICT) are all set to host the Joburg Super Kings (JSK) in the Match No. 15 on Tuesday, January 6 at the Newlands in Cape Town. 

The alarm bells are ringing, and MI Cape Town are on the brink of elimination already from the ongoing season. The franchise has failed to register a single win so far out of the five matches they have featured in. Their previous game saw them fail to post even 100 runs on the board, which was later chased down by the Paarl Royals with rather ease. They are in a dire need to pick up a win now.


The Joburg Super Kings, on the other hand, are the table toppers with an absolute domination on the points table. The Faf du Plessis-led side is yet to lose a single match this match, with 15 points to their tally after four matches. They already have a hat-trick of wins, but won't mind making it a double hat-trick and bolster their top spot on the table. High on confidence, the Super Kings will be eyeing to beat the hosts.

Squads:
Joburg Super Kings Squad: Matthew De Villiers, Faf du Plessis(c), Rilee Rossouw, Wiaan Mulder, Shubham Ranjane, Donovan Ferreira(w), Dian Forrester, Prenelan Subrayen, Duan Jansen, Akeal Hosein, Richard Gleeson, Rivaldo Moonsamy, Nandre Burger, Steve Stolk, Janco Smit, Neil Timmers, Jarren Bacher, Daniel Worrall, Reece Topley, Imran Tahir, James Vince
MI Cape Town Squad: Ryan Rickelton(w), Rassie van der Dussen, Reeza Hendricks, Nicholas Pooran, Jason Smith, Tom Moores, George Linde, Rashid Khan(c), Corbin Bosch, Kagiso Rabada, Trent Boult, Jacques Snyman, Dane Piedt, Thomas Kaber, Tiaan van Vuuren, Tristan Luus, Daniel Lategan, Dwaine Pretorius, Karim Janat
